diff_hunk:
@@ -551,6 +551,81 @@ def __repr__(self):
         tmpstr = tmpstr + ')'
         return tmpstr
 
+    def summary(self, input_size):
+        def register_hook(module):
+            def hook(module, input, output):
+                class_name = str(module.__class__).split('.')[-1].split("'")[0]
+                module_idx = len(summary)
+                m_key = '%s-%i' % (class_name, module_idx + 1)
+                summary[m_key] = OrderedDict()
+                summary[m_key]['input_shape'] = list(input[0].size())
+                summary[m_key]['input_shape'][0] = None
+                summary[m_key]['output_shape'] = list(output.size())
+                summary[m_key]['output_shape'][0] = None
+
+                params = 0
+                if hasattr(module, 'weight'):
+                    params += torch.prod(torch.LongTensor(list(module.weight.size())))
+                    if module.weight.requires_grad:
+                        summary[m_key]['trainable'] = True
+                    else:
+                        summary[m_key]['trainable'] = False
+                if hasattr(module, 'bias'):
+                    params += torch.prod(torch.LongTensor(list(module.bias.size())))
+                summary[m_key]['nb_params'] = params
+
+            if not isinstance(module, torch.nn.Sequential) and \
+               not isinstance(module, torch.nn.ModuleList) and \
+               not (module == self):
+                hooks.append(module.register_forward_hook(hook))
+
+        # check if there are multiple inputs to the network
+        if isinstance(input_size[0], (list, tuple)):
+            x = [Variable(th.rand(1, *in_size)) for in_size in input_size]
+        else:
+            x = Variable(torch.randn(1, *input_size))
+
+        # create properties
+        summary = OrderedDict()
+        hooks = []
+        # register hook
+        self.apply(register_hook)
+        # make a forward pass
+        self(x)
+        # remove these hooks
+        for h in hooks:
+            h.remove()
+
+        # print out neatly
+        names = list(self._modules.keys())
body: I believe [`apply`](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.Module.apply) goes recursively to submodules? I think this is not an issue.
body_html: I believe apply goes recursively to submodules? I think this is not an issue.
body_text: I believe apply goes recursively to submodules? I think this is not an issue.
